marketNews.title: 8 Issuers Ready for IPO in July 2025
marketNews.content:
The Indonesia Stock Exchange will welcome 8 new prospective issuers in July 2025. This summary is compiled based on the order in which the companies will first undergo public offerings and listing on the exchange:
1. Asia Pramulia ($ASPR): Producer of rigid plastic packaging such as bottles, jars, and industrial packaging. The company's customers include Konimex, Club bottled water, Nippon Paint, Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology ($SMAR), and Indofood Sukses Makmur ($INDF). Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 100.7 billion rupiah, with 46% for capex to purchase machinery and the remainder for working capital.
2. Pancaran Samudera Transport ($PSAT): Engaged in the sea transportation business for general and special cargo, including coal, nickel, and fertilizer. The company's customers include PT Kideco Jaya Agung and Vale Indonesia ($INCO). Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 200.1 billion rupiah, with 87.4% for capex to purchase 2 bulk carrier ships and the remainder for working capital.
3. Chandra Daya Investasi ($CDIA): A subsidiary of Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) together with EGCO Group (Phoenix Power). Engaged in infrastructure holding, including energy, water, port services and storage, and logistics. Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 2.4 trillion rupiah, with 37% for capital injection to logistics business subsidiaries and 63% for port and storage business subsidiaries.
4. Indokripto Koin Semesta ($COIN): A holding company for PT Central Finansial X which is engaged in the futures exchange and crypto asset exchange business, and PT Kustodian Koin Indonesia which provides crypto custodian services. Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 220.6 billion rupiah, with ~85% for working capital for PT Central Finansial X and the remainder for working capital for PT Kustodian Koin Indonesia.
5. Prima Multi Usaha Indonesia ($PMUI): Engaged as a distributor of XL brand telecommunication products, controlling approximately 35% of XL's regional coverage and sales. PMUI is the parent of Graha Prima Mentari ($GRPM) with an ownership stake of 70.67%. Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 208.8 billion rupiah, with 43% for working capital, ~29% for loans to GRPM for expansion and debt repayment, and the remainder for land and building purchases.
6. Merry Riana Edukasi ($MERI): A holding company housing subsidiaries in the education sector (courses and training institutions) founded by Merry Riana. Tancorp through PT Tancorp Investama Mulia - which is also a shareholder of $ZONE and $BLES - is one of MERI's shareholders with an ownership stake of 19.32% after the IPO. Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 30.1 billion rupiah, allocated for: 1) ~65% for learning center lease costs, marketing costs, human resource development costs, and others; and 2) the remainder for Merry Riana Event venue costs, marketing costs, and others.
7. Trimitra Trans Persada ($BLOG): An integrated logistics company consisting of land transportation and warehousing services. The controlling shareholder of the company is PT Sigmantara Alfindo, which is also the controller of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya ($AMRT). Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 140.8 billion rupiah, with ~67% to finance the construction of 3 cold warehouses, while the remainder is for purchasing light trucks.
8. Diastika Biotekindo ($CHEK): Engaged in the distribution of laboratory, pharmaceutical, and medical equipment, with 2 main focuses: clinical diagnostics (human disease diagnosis) and life sciences (for laboratory research needs). The company is a supplier to Prodia Widyahusada ($PRDA). Potential funds raised from the IPO reach 104.3 billion rupiah, all of which will be used as working capital.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We observe that the large number of concurrent IPOs impacts IHSG trading liquidity. In the past 1 week, the average IHSG transaction value reached only 8.8 trillion rupiah per day, compared to the average of the last month which was 14 trillion rupiah per day.

marketNews.title: LABA Among Potential Buyers of 70% of KRYA Shares
marketNews.content:
1. $KRYA: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya announced that Green Power Group ($LABA) is one of the prospective buyers of KRYA shares, alongside Rich Step International Ltd., PT EVMOTO Teknologi Indonesia, PT Huashang Investment Group, and PT Cahaya Intan Niaga. Furthermore, KRYA stated that these prospective buyers will collectively purchase a total of 70% of the company's shares from the prospective sellers, meaning the prospective buyers will jointly and proportionally become the new controllers of KRYA. The transaction value has not yet been announced. In a separate information disclosure, LABA explained that this transaction plan is intended as an effort for "synergy in the EBT industry in the future." The prospective sellers of KRYA shares in this transaction plan consist of PT Bangun Karya Artha Lestari, Hok Gwan (Dharmo Budiono), Brigitta Notoatmodjo, and Pramana Budihardjo.
2. $ADMR: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia through its subsidiary, PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium (AIA), and Cita Mineral Investindo ($CITA) announced they have injected capital into PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry amounting to ~947.5 billion rupiah and ~182.2 billion rupiah respectively through new share issuance. Besides AIA and CITA, new shares were also taken up by other existing shareholders, Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. In total, through this new share issuance, PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry received a total capital injection of ~1.5 trillion rupiah from its shareholders. After this new share issuance, the ownership of the three shareholders in PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry remains unchanged, with AIA holding 65% of the shares, while Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. holds 22.5% and CITA holds 12.5%. ADMR and CITA explained that this transaction is carried out in order to support PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry, which is currently developing an aluminum smelter with an initial capacity of 500,000 tons of aluminum ingot per year.
3. $TOTL: The Corporate Secretary of Total Bangun Persada, Anggie S. Sidharta, told Kontan that the company recorded new contract values of approximately 2.5 trillion rupiah during 1H25 (-24.5% YoY), equivalent to 49.8% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. Kontan also reported that TOTL is participating in several tenders with a pipeline of around 12.6 trillion rupiah.
4. $FAST: Fast Food Indonesia sold a 15% stake in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia to PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara for 54.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, FAST's ownership in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia decreased from 70% to 55%. PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia itself is currently building an integrated chicken farm on an area of approximately 8.6 million square meters in Banyuwangi, East Java. PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara is a company owned by the daughter of Andi Syamsudin Arsyad (Haji Isam), Liana Saputri, and her husband, Putra Rizky Bustaman.
5. $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara announced that it will conduct a joint study with Mubadala Energy South Andaman RSC Ltd. regarding the utilization of natural gas and the development of pipeline gas and/or LNG infrastructure from the South Andaman working area. Previously, the two parties had also signed a memorandum of understanding in October 2024 to conduct a special study on the Arun Refinery facilities and regasification terminal to support upstream oil and gas activities.

marketNews.title: Other hot news you need to know
marketNews.content:
1. US President, Donald Trump, announced that the US and Vietnam have reached a trade agreement. Under the agreement, Trump stated that the US will impose a 20% tariff on imports from Vietnam and a 40% tariff on goods from other countries transported through Vietnam. Trump also mentioned that Vietnam will lift all tariffs on US imports. The tariff for goods imported from Vietnam is lower than the initial tariff announced in April 2025 at the level of 46%. Although Trump has announced the outline of the agreement, the terms and details have not been released by the White House. Trump's announcement came just a few days before the tariff negotiation deadline on July 9, 2025.
2. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that Indonesia will sign a memorandum of understanding worth 34 billion US dollars on July 7, 2025, for investment and imports of goods from the US. Airlangga explained that the package includes energy purchases worth 15.5 billion US dollars, as well as agricultural goods purchases whose value was not specified. This agreement is part of tariff negotiations with the US, where Indonesia was subject to a 32% tariff in April 2025. Airlangga stated that by addressing the trade balance with the US, Indonesia hopes to achieve a better trade agreement than the one reached by Vietnam. According to US Trade Representative data, Indonesia enjoyed a trade surplus with the US of 17.9 billion US dollars throughout 2024.
3. Saudi Press Agency reported that Indonesia and Saudi Arabia have signed several agreements and memoranda of understanding worth approximately 27 billion US dollars. This cooperation will involve the private sectors of both countries in various fields, including clean energy and petrochemicals. Indonesia and Saudi Arabia also agreed to increase cooperation in the supply of crude oil and its derivatives, enhance the energy supply chain and sustainability, and strengthen cooperation in mineral resources. Meanwhile, Reuters reported that ACWA Power from Saudi Arabia has signed an initial agreement to explore investment opportunities in renewable energy projects together with BPI Danantara and PT Pertamina. These companies are expected to explore investment potential with project financing up to 10 billion US dollars.
4. The President Director of Krakatau Steel ($KRAS), Akbar Djohan, stated that the company signed a memorandum of understanding with Xiamen ITG Group Co. Ltd. and PT Dexin Steel Indonesia for the development of steel products such as slab, hot rolled coil, and other potential cooperation.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group ($LABA) confirmed as prospective buyer of 70% stake in Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya ($KRYA)
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya [announced] that Green Power Group ($LABA) became one of the prospective buyers of KRYA shares, in addition to Rich Step International Ltd., PT EVMOTO Teknologi Indonesia, PT Huashang Investment Group, and PT Cahaya Intan Niaga. Furthermore, KRYA also mentioned that these prospective buyers will purchase a total of 70% of the company's shares from the prospective sellers, so the prospective buyers jointly and proportionally will become the new controller of KRYA. The transaction value has not yet been announced. In a separate [information disclosure], LABA explained that this transaction plan targets efforts for "synergy in the EBT industry in the future." The prospective sellers of KRYA shares in this transaction plan consist of PT Bangun Karya Artha Lestari, Hok Gwan (Dharmo Budiono), Brigitta Notoatmodjo, and Pramana Budihardjo.

tickerNews.title: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR) and Cita Mineral Investindo ($CITA) inject capital into PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry to support aluminum smelter development
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia through its subsidiary, PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium (AIA), and Cita Mineral Investindo ($CITA) announced they have injected capital into PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry amounting to ~947.5 billion rupiah and ~182.2 billion rupiah respectively through new share issuance. Besides AIA and CITA, new shares were also taken up by other existing shareholders, Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. In total through this new share issuance, PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry received a capital injection of ~1.5 trillion rupiah from its shareholders. After this new share issuance, the ownership of the three shareholders in PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry remains unchanged, with AIA having 65% of shares, while Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. has 22.5% and CITA has 12.5%. ADMR and CITA explained that this transaction is carried out in order to support PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry, which is currently developing an aluminum smelter with an initial capacity of 500,000 tons of aluminum ingot per year.

tickerNews.title: Total Bangun Persada ($TOTL) records new contract value of ~2.5 trillion rupiah in 1H25
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of Total Bangun Persada, Anggie S. Sidharta, told Kontan that the company recorded new contract values of approximately 2.5 trillion rupiah during 1H25 (-24.5% YoY), equivalent to 49.8% of the 2025 target set at 5 trillion rupiah. Kontan also reported that TOTL is following several tenders with a pipeline of around 12.6 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.content: Fast Food Indonesia sold a 15% stake in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia to PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara for 54.4 billion rupiah. Following [this transaction], FAST's ownership in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia decreased from 70% to 55%. PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia itself is currently building an integrated chicken farm on an area of approximately 8.6 million square meters in Banyuwangi, East Java. PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara is a company owned by the daughter of Andi Syamsudin Arsyad (Haji Isam), Liana Saputri, and her husband, Putra Rizky Bustaman.

tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara [announced] it will conduct a joint study with Mubadala Energy South Andaman RSC Ltd. regarding the utilization of natural gas and the development of pipeline gas and/or LNG infrastructure from the South Andaman working area. Previously, the two parties had also signed a memorandum of understanding in October 2024 to conduct a special study on the Arun Refinery facilities and regasification terminal to support upstream oil and gas activities.
